about.title: About ANAE
about.intro: The National Association of Algerians in Spain (ANAE) stands as a beacon of cultural promotion and sociocultural mediation for the Algerian community and the diverse cultures present in Spain. Our commitment focuses on promoting Algerian culture, strengthening the identity of our compatriots, and building bridges of understanding between the various communities living in this country.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: ANAE strives to be a meeting point and support for Algerians in Spain. Our main objectives are:

culture.title: Promote Algerian Culture
culture.description: We organize cultural events, exhibitions, film screenings, workshops, and conferences to spread Algeria's rich cultural heritage among the Algerian community and the Spanish public in general.

mediation.title: Sociocultural Mediation
mediation.description: We offer guidance and mediation services to facilitate the integration of Algerians into Spanish society. Additionally, we promote intercultural dialogue and social cohesion among the different communities present in Spain.

activities.title: Meetings and Activities
activities.description: We organize regular gatherings where Algerians can meet, share experiences, establish support networks, and participate in recreational and educational activities.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: ANAE is founded on values of solidarity, respect, inclusion, and diversity. We strive to create a welcoming and collaborative environment where all people feel valued and respected, regardless of their cultural or religious background.

join.title: Join Us
join.description: If you are Algerian and in Spain, we invite you to join ANAE and become part of our community. Together, we can strengthen our cultural identity, promote integration, and contribute to the mutual enrichment between the different cultures coexisting in this beautiful country.
join.closing: Welcome to the National Association of Algerians in Spain! Together, we will build a more prosperous and harmonious future for everyone.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
whatWeDo.description: Our association works to strengthen bonds within the Algerian community in Spain and promote cultural integration. We create spaces for meeting, exchange, and solidarity.

culturalEvents.title: Cultural Events
culturalEvents.description: We regularly organize cultural events to promote the rich Algerian culture in Spain. Art exhibitions, traditional music concerts, conferences on Algerian history and literature, as well as gastronomy workshops allow us to share our heritage with the Spanish community and strengthen intercultural ties.

ramadanIftar.title: Ramadan Iftar
ramadanIftar.description: Every year, our association organizes a Ramadan iftar to help people in difficulty who cannot live and eat in the conditions of Ramadan. Thanks to the generosity of our contributors and donors, we provide meals and essential support to those most in need during this traditional Algerian period. It is a moment of solidarity and sharing that strengthens community bonds and perpetuates our values of mutual aid.

services.title: Services & Coordination
services.description: Our association ensures coordination with the Algerian consulate and Spanish authorities to facilitate the administrative procedures of the Algerian community. We serve as an intermediary and point of contact for matters related to documents, legalization, residency formalities, and other administrative procedures necessary for integration in Spain.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This page informs you about the use of cookies on our website. We respect your privacy and are transparent about the cookies we use.

whatAre.title: 1. What is a Cookie?
whatAre.description: A cookie is a small text file stored on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit a website. Cookies allow the site to remember your preferences and improve your browsing experience.

types.title: 2. Types of Cookies Used
types.description: Our website uses only essential technical cookies, strictly necessary for the proper functioning of the site. We do not use tracking, advertising, or analytics cookies.

technical.title: Technical Cookies (Essential)
technical.description: These cookies are essential for the site's functionality and do not require consent under GDPR:

list.session: Session cookies: maintain your active session during your visit (duration: session, deleted when browser closes)
list.security: Security cookies: protect the site against attacks and ensure data security (duration: session)
list.preferences: Preference cookies: remember your language and display choices (if applicable)

notUsed.title: Cookies Not Used
notUsed.description: We do NOT use the following types of cookies:

purpose.title: 3. Purpose of Cookies
purpose.description: The technical cookies we use serve only to:

list.functionality: Ensure the proper functioning of the site
list.security: Maintain the security of your session
list.preferences: Remember your language and display preferences (if applicable)

duration.title: 4. Retention Period
duration.session: Automatically deleted when you close your browser (session cookies)
duration.temporary: Strictly temporary and do not persist after your visit

thirdParty.title: 5. Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.description: Our website does not use any third-party cookies. All cookies used are first-party cookies, managed directly by our site.

management.title: 6. Cookie Management
management.description: You can manage or delete cookies at any time through your browser settings:

instructions.chrome: Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies
instructions.edge: Edge: Settings > Privacy, search, and services > Cookies

management.note: Note: Disabling technical cookies may affect the site's functionality.

consent.title: 7. Consent
consent.description: According to GDPR, essential technical cookies do not require prior consent as they are strictly necessary for the site's functioning. Since we only use essential cookies, no consent banner is required.
consent.future: If we were to introduce non-essential cookies in the future (analytics cookies, for example), we would implement a GDPR-compliant consent system.

updates.description: We may update this cookie policy from time to time. Any changes will be published on this page with a revised update date.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Find answers to the most common questions about our association, our actions, our donations, and how to join us.

questions.question: What exactly does your association do?
questions.answer: The National Association of Algerians in Spain (ANAE) works for cultural promotion and sociocultural mediation. We organize cultural events (exhibitions, film screenings, workshops, conferences), offer mediation and guidance services to facilitate the integration of Algerians in Spain, and coordinate with the Algerian consulate and Spanish authorities for administrative procedures. We also organize regular meetings to strengthen community bonds and promote intercultural dialogue.

questions.question: Why was this association created?
questions.answer: ANAE was created to respond to the needs of the Algerian community in Spain. We identified the need to create a space for meeting, support, and cultural promotion that allows Algerians to maintain their cultural identity while fostering their integration into Spanish society. The association serves as a bridge between cultures and facilitates mutual understanding between different communities.

questions.question: What is your long-term vision?
questions.answer: Our long-term vision is to become a reference for the Algerian community in Spain, strengthening cultural ties, fostering social integration, and contributing to mutual enrichment between cultures. We aspire to expand our activities, develop more aid and mediation programs, and create a strong support network that benefits not only Algerians but all of Spanish society through intercultural dialogue.

questions.question: Are you officially recognized (LEY ORG√ÅNICA 1/2002, de 22 de marzo)?
questions.answer: Yes, ANAE is an officially registered association in Spain. We are registered in the Spanish National Association Registry. Our tax identification number (NIF) is G01968437. As a non-profit association, we comply with all Spanish legal and regulatory obligations. We maintain total transparency in our activities and financial management.

questions.question: Where are you based?
questions.answer: Our association is based in Zaragoza, Spain. That's where our main office is located. Although we are located in Zaragoza, our activities and impact extend throughout Spain, and we work with members and beneficiaries in different regions of the country.

questions.question: How to make a donation?
questions.answer: You can make a donation in several ways: via PayPal (secure online payment), via Bizum (instant mobile payment to number 654 155 924), or by SEPA bank transfer to IBAN ES81 0049 0401 1122 1027 2614 to the beneficiary 'Asociaci√≥n Nacional de Argelinos en Espa√±a'. All payments are 100% secure. You will find the 'Donate' button in the navigation menu of our website.

questions.question: Where do donations go?
questions.answer: Donations are used exclusively to fund our activities and programs: organizing cultural events (exhibitions, conferences, workshops), helping people in difficulty (especially during our annual Ramadan iftar), mediation and guidance services, administrative coordination with authorities, and the development of our community activities. Every euro directly contributes to supporting the Algerian community in Spain and promoting intercultural dialogue.

questions.question: How can I be sure my money is being used properly?
questions.answer: We guarantee total transparency in the use of funds. As an officially registered association (NIF: G01968437), we comply with all Spanish accounting and legal obligations. We keep all financial documents for 7 years in accordance with Spanish legislation. You can contact us at any time to obtain information on the use of funds. We are committed to using each donation responsibly and effectively to maximize our impact on the community.

questions.question: How to become a volunteer?
questions.answer: To become a volunteer, you can contact us by email at contacto@asociacionanae.org or by phone at +34 674 748 699. We welcome anyone who wishes to contribute to our activities, whether Algerian or not. Volunteers can participate in organizing cultural events, helping people in difficulty, mediation, or other activities according to their skills and availability.

questions.question: Do you accept remote / foreign volunteers?
questions.answer: Yes, we accept remote and foreign volunteers. Some of our activities can be carried out online, such as social media management, translation, content creation, event coordination, or administrative support. If you are interested in remote volunteering, contact us to discuss available opportunities and see how you can contribute according to your skills and location.

questions.question: Who benefits from your actions?
questions.answer: Our actions primarily benefit the Algerian community in Spain, especially people in difficulty, newcomers who need help with their integration, and all those who wish to maintain and share their culture. We also help people who cannot live and eat in Ramadan conditions during our annual iftar. In addition, our cultural and mediation activities benefit all of Spanish society by fostering intercultural dialogue and mutual understanding between different communities.

questions.question: How to contact you?
questions.answer: You can contact us in several ways: by email at contacto@asociacionanae.org (we usually respond within 24h), via WhatsApp, or by using the contact form on our website. You can also follow us on our social networks (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram) to stay informed about our activities. Our main office is located in Zaragoza, Spain.
